decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells while utilizing Slimefoot and Squee as the commanders. The deck includes a variety of creatures with strong abilities and synergies, such as Grist, the Hunger Tide and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, as well as efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes a number of powerful mana ramp cards like Wild Growth and Utopia Sprawl to ensure a consistent mana base. With a strong mix of threats and answers, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the early game and maintain control throughout the match.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and disrupt their game plan. The commander, Flamewar, Brash Veteran, serves as a powerful and aggressive creature that can lead the charge in dealing damage. The deck also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to handle threats from the opponent. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to be fast and efficient, putting pressure on the opponent early on and maintaining control of the game through disruption and removal spells.

This control deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and creatures with disruptive abilities to control the game and prevent opponents from developing their board state. With a mix of efficient counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Will, versatile removal like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt, and disruptive creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control of the game. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six for additional control and card advantage. By controlling the game and dictating the pace of play, this deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive game-play with a strong emphasis on dealing direct damage to the opponent's life total using burn spells and efficient creatures. Ghyrson Starn, Kelermorph is used as the commander to support this strategy, providing additional firepower and card advantage. The deck contains a variety of burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Fiery Confluence, as well as aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and Monastery Swiftspear. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to apply pressure early, maintain tempo, and finish off the opponent quickly with direct damage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using a variety of disruption spells and removal, while also utilizing Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger as the commander to pressure the opponent's hand and resources. The deck includes a mix of discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. It also features graveyard recursion with cards like Reanimate and Unmarked Grave to constantly bring Kroxa back into play and keep the pressure on. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, deal damage with Kroxa, and ultimately outvalue the opponent to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander match.

The deck revolves around aggressive play with Lord Skitter, Sewer King as the commander. It focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Dismember while using creatures like Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet to pressure the opponent. The strategy includes disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Hymn to Tourach, as well as recurring threats from the graveyard with cards like Reanimate and Unearth. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts like Skullclamp and Shadowspear to enhance its creatures. Overall, the key concept is to disrupt, control, and apply continuous pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.
